title: Kubernetes related infrastructure
content:
This topic provides you the required specifications to configure the Kubernetes requirements. 

If you are deploying Operations Platform with Embedded Kubernetes, you can skip this page.

While setting up any of the Kubernetes clusters, ensure that you adhere to the networking model described in the Kubernetes documentation.

Amazon Elastic Kubernetes (EKS)

To set up an EKS cluster, see Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS). 

Deployment on Amazon Web Services China Regions isn't supported.

Operations Platform and applications support TLS 1.3 for an AWS Load Balancer instance created without using ITOM Cloud Deployment toolkit and with a security policy that supports TLS 1.3.

Points to note while creating an EKS

  • While creating the resources for EKS, you must use the same EKS cluster name when creating the VPC, EKS cluster, and worker nodes; otherwise, the installation fails.
  • Operations Platform and applications support single and multi availability zone deployment for the Amazon Web Services EKS cluster worker nodes. You can choose to deploy either on a single AZ or multiple AZ according to your requirement. If you install this release with a single AZ deployment, you can't change it to a multi AZ deployment later. AWS doesn't support converting a single AZ deployment to multi AZ deployment. You can't upgrade your previous single AZ deployment to a multi AZ deployment.
  • You must label the nodes as following: 
    "node_type" : "worker",
"Worker" : "label",
"role" : "loadbalancer",

    For more information on labels, see Labels and Selectors in Kubernetes documentation.

Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)

To set up an AKS cluster, see Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

Points to note while creating an AKS

  • You must place all the created resources in the same VNet to prevent performance issues caused by network latency, including resource group, AKS cluster, bastion, Azure file share, Azure NetApp Files, PostgreSQL, etc. 
  • Don't route the internal traffic inside this VNet out to another VNet (for example, a firewall VNet). Make sure all the traffic between the created resources is within the same VNet.
  • AKS isn't compatible with Azure Security Center. Therefore, if you enable Azure Security Center on a subscription, there will be disk IOPS spikes on all worker nodes of all AKS clusters in the subscription
  • You must label the nodes as following: 
    "node_type" : "worker",
"Worker" : "label",
"role" : "loadbalancer",

    For more information on creating a cluster with labels in AKS, see Use labels in an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster.

    For more information on labels, see Labels and Selectors in Kubernetes documentation.

Google Kubernetes Engine

To set up a GKE cluster, see Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE).

Point to note while creating a GKE

  • The Kubernetes Engine Admin user should have permissions to the Compute Engine default service account.
  • The user account should have Service Networking Admin permissions.

Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform

To set up a Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform cluster, see Red Hat OpenShift documentation.
